chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall p : nat, p <> 1 /\ (forall a : nat, a <> 1 -> a <> p -> ~ divides p a) <-> is_prime p

Premises:
divides = fun a b : nat => exists q : nat, a = b * q : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments divides (_ _)%nat_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
is_prime = fun p : nat => p <> 1 /\ (forall d : nat, divides p d -> d = 1 \/ d = p) : nat -> Prop Arguments is_prime _%nat_scope
divides_prime : forall a : nat, (exists p : nat, p <> a /\ is_prime p /\ divides a p) -> ~ is_prime a
divides_nat : forall n : nat, {p : nat | p <> 1 /\ p <> n /\ divides n p} + {forall p : nat, p <> 1 -> p <> n -> ~ divides n p}
gcd_prime : forall p : nat, p <> 1 -> (forall d a : nat, is_gcd d a p -> d = 1 \/ d = p) -> is_prime p
prime_square : forall p a : nat, is_prime p -> divides (square a) p -> divides a p
prime_div_gcd : forall p a : nat, is_prime p -> ~ divides a p -> rel_prime p a
prime_rel_prime : forall p a : nat, is_prime p -> ~ rel_prime a p -> divides a p
prime_mult : forall p a b : nat, is_prime p -> divides (a * b) p -> divides a p \/ divides b p
prime_gcd : forall d p a : nat, is_prime p -> is_gcd d a p -> d = 1 \/ d = p
non_div_1 : forall a : nat, a <> 1 -> ~ divides 1 a
prime_power : forall p n x : nat, is_prime p -> divides (power x n) p -> divides x p
prime_power_qn : forall p n q x : nat, is_prime p -> divides (power x n) (power p (q * n)) -> 1 <= n -> divides x (power p q)
Nat.log2_add_le : forall a b : nat, a <> 1 -> b <> 1 -> Nat.log2 (a + b) <= Nat.log2 a + Nat.log2 b
Nat.log2_up_add_le : forall a b : nat, a <> 1 -> b <> 1 -> Nat.log2_up (a + b) <= Nat.log2_up a + Nat.log2_up b
divides_le : forall a b : nat, a <> 0 -> divides a b -> b <= a
Nat.gauss : forall n m p : nat, Nat.divide n (m * p) -> Nat.gcd n m = 1 -> Nat.divide n p
Nat.lt_le_trans : forall n m p : nat, n < m -> m <= p -> n < p
Nat.add_le_mono_l : forall n m p : nat, n <= m < -> p + n <= p + m
Nat.add_le_mono_r : forall n m p : nat, n <= m < -> n + p <= m + p
Nat.add_lt_mono_r : forall n m p : nat, n < m < -> n + p < m + p
mult_le_compat_r : forall n m p : nat, n <= m -> n * p <= m * p
Nat.mul_lt_pred : forall p q n m : nat, S p = q -> p * n < p * m < -> q * n + m < q * m + n
Nat.add_lt_mono : forall n m p q : nat, n < m -> p < q -> n + p < m + q
Nat.add_le_mono : forall n m p q : nat, n <= m -> p <= q -> n + p <= m + q
mult_le_compat : forall n m p q : nat, n <= m -> p <= q -> n * p <= m * q
Nat.Bezout = fun n m p : nat => exists a b : nat, a * n = p + b * m : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.Bezout (_ _ _)%nat_scope
mult_lemma6 : forall a b n : nat, n <> 0 -> n * a = n * b -> a = b
Nat.log2_up_spec : forall a : nat, 1 < a -> 2 ^ Nat.pred (Nat.log2_up a) < a <= 2 ^ Nat.log2_up a
Nat.divide_add_cancel_r : forall n m p : nat, Nat.divide n m -> Nat.divide n (m + p) -> Nat.divide n p
Pos2Nat.inj : forall p q : positive, Pos.to_nat p = Pos.to_nat q -> p = q
divides_minus : forall d a b : nat, divides a d -> divides b d -> divides (b - a) d
Nat.mul_add_distr_r : forall n m p : nat, (n + m) * p = n * p + m * p
Nat.mul_sub_distr_r : forall n m p : nat, (n - m) * p = n * p - m * p

divides_euclide : forall (a b : nat) (H : b <> 0), divides a b < -> remainder_euclide a b H = 0
Nat.log2_null : forall a : nat, Nat.log2 a = 0 < -> a <= 1
Nat.log2_up_null : forall a : nat, Nat.log2_up a = 0 < -> a <= 1
Nat.add_le_mul : forall a b : nat, 1 < a -> 1 < b -> a + b <= a * b
Nat.log2_up_eqn0 : forall a : nat, a <= 1 -> Nat.log2_up a = 0
Nat.log2_pos : forall a : nat, 1 < a -> 0 < Nat.log2 a
